title: How to Make a Jack O'Lantern from an Orange

steps.headline: Wash each orange well.
steps.description: Remove any grime or stains. Dry by wiping with a dishcloth or paper towel.

steps.headline: Slice the tops off each orange.
steps.description: Use a sharp knife to slice, while keeping the orange still on a flat surface.

steps.headline: Scoop the flesh out of each orange.
steps.description:
Use the spoon to slip around the edges of the orange flesh and scoop it out in pieces. The flesh can be used to make orange juice or to bake with. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Draw a basic face design on the outside of one orange.
steps.description: Two triangle eyes, a little triangle nose and a smile are all you'll need to do. The smaller the citrus fruit, the simpler the design needs to be.

steps.headline: Cut out the design with nail scissors.
Repeat for the other oranges.
steps.description: After cutting the first one, you might feel comfortable enough to cut shapes without marking; do whatever works best for you.

parts.name: Displaying the Orange Jack O' Lanterns

steps.headline: Place a votive candle or tea light candle inside the orange Jack O'Lanterns.
Arrange in a display.
steps.description: You can place single orange Jack o'Lanterns wherever you'd like one on display. Or, place them in a cute little row, next to one another. A long silver sweets tray is ideal for this type of display.

steps.headline: Light the candles.
steps.description: Set the little orange Jack O'Lanterns  aglow.

tyn: 2-3 oranges (mandarins, grapefruit, tangelos, etc. can also be used); obviously, you can make more if wished
A big metal spoon for scooping
Small sharp scissors, such as nail scissors
Votive candles or tea light candles
Display props, such as a sweet tray (optional)
text:
Preparing the Oranges Wash each orange well. Remove any grime or stains. Dry by wiping with a dishcloth or paper towel. Slice the tops off each orange. Use a sharp knife to slice, while keeping the orange still on a flat surface. Scoop the flesh out of each orange. Use the spoon to slip around the edges of the orange flesh and scoop it out in pieces. The flesh can be used to make orange juice or to bake with. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cutting the Face Draw a basic face design on the outside of one orange. Two triangle eyes, a little triangle nose and a smile are all you'll need to do. The smaller the citrus fruit, the simpler the design needs to be. Cut out the design with nail scissors. Repeat for the other oranges. After cutting the first one, you might feel comfortable enough to cut shapes without marking; do whatever works best for you. Displaying the Orange Jack O' Lanterns Place a votive candle or tea light candle inside the orange Jack O'Lanterns. Arrange in a display. You can place single orange Jack o'Lanterns wherever you'd like one on display. Or, place them in a cute little row, next to one another. A long silver sweets tray is ideal for this type of display. Light the candles. Set the little orange Jack O'Lanterns aglow.
sentences: Preparing the Oranges Wash each orange well.
Remove any grime or stains.
Dry by wiping with a dishcloth or paper towel.
Slice the tops off each orange.
Use a sharp knife to slice, while keeping the orange still on a flat surface.
Scoop the flesh out of each orange.
Use the spoon to slip around the edges of the orange flesh and scoop it out in pieces.
The flesh can be used to make orange juice or to bake with.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/8\/84\/Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-a-Jack-O%27Lantern-from-an-Orange-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Cutting the Face Draw a basic face design on the outside of one orange.
Two triangle eyes, a little triangle nose and a smile are all you'll need to do.
The smaller the citrus fruit, the simpler the design needs to be.
Cut out the design with nail scissors.
Repeat for the other oranges.
After cutting the first one, you might feel comfortable enough to cut shapes without marking; do whatever works best for you.
Displaying the Orange Jack O' Lanterns Place a votive candle or tea light candle inside the orange Jack O'Lanterns.
Arrange in a display.
You can place single orange Jack o'Lanterns wherever you'd like one on display.
Or, place them in a cute little row, next to one another.
A long silver sweets tray is ideal for this type of display.
Light the candles.
Set the little orange Jack O'Lanterns  aglow.
